intro: Beilschmiedia collina, commonly known as the narrow-leafed beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and lanceolate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and produces small, yellowish flowers followed by dark purple berries. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine, and it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity by providing habitat and food for various animals.
